title: Free African Americans in antebellum per. - rights

content.question: In the antebellum period, free African Americans were

choices.label: given the right of suffrage in most states
protected from kidnapping under stringent provisions of the Fugitive Slave Act
educated in integrated schools in most northern states
able to settle in states in the Middle West without legal restriction
able to accumulate some property in spite of discrimination

content.answer: able to accumulate some property in spite of discrimination

topic.text: 4.12: African Americans in the Early Republic

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Identify a historical concept, development, or process.
